pr_title: Fix for null pointer exception with order by by array/object type

timeline.message: index on FixForOrderByQuery: e599af164d9 Reliable download range error (#12342)
add array/object type support for order by query

timeline.bodyText: code style: "{" on the same line as class definition.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
code style: java static field name all caps:
Null -> NULL
PropertyName -> PROPERTY_NAME
timeline.author: moderakh
moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
to be consistent with existing tests:
drop the "Test" prefix. here and other new tests..
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: the exception message is not correct you are not passing any arg to need String.format and %s
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
yea, a typo, want to pass the type and the exception message, changed to following:
String.format("Exception for getting hash for type %s: %s ", type1.toString(), e.getMessage())
replies.author: xinlian12

timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
with this you will be loosing the cause exception stacktrace.
You probably want to keep the root cause exception stacktrace.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
I see, good point, changed to following:
new IllegalStateException(String.format("Getting hash exception for type %s ", type1.toString()), e)
replies.author: xinlian12

timeline.bodyText:
I think there is a possible infinite recursion scenario here.
This calls getHashFromJsonSerializable -> which then again calls this method getHash by casing resource to JsonSerializable
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: it will return ObjectNode for the propertyBag, so should not have endless loop
replies.author: xinlian12

timeline.bodyText:
I think this is a typo ->
this.high < this.high -> should be -> this.high < other.high ??
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
I can see a possibility to merge the logic of this function - getHashFromList and getHashFromArrayNode since the logic is exactly same.
Or @xinlian12  do you want to keep it separate for more readability ? The only downside of keeping them separate is that if we have a bug in one logic, we could have it in other logic as well and we will have to fix them separately.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: I combined into one: getHashFromIterator, was not sure which way I should choose, but I agree it is better to keep the same logic in same method
replies.author: xinlian12

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this exception message makes sense, since there is no type1 in this try catch block.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: hmmm, we could remove the type from the exception message, but thought it might give some hint which type is having hash issue?
replies.author: xinlian12

replies.bodyText:
why only type1 and not type2 ?
Also, what does type1.toString() represents ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
since we can only reach to this step when type1 equals type2, so I think either should work.
it will tell us whether it is objectNode or arrayNode. (The name of the ItemType enum)
replies.author: xinlian12
